page.title: 03Farms, Crop Size and Opinion
page.content: {Adbaston} Mean areas (ha) of crops on mixed and arable farms are:- Wheat 21, Barley 17,Sugar Beet 2.5,Oilseed rape 5 The remaining mixed farm area was grass divided equally between intensive and pasture. An average of 6 ha of feed barley was grown on 'livestock only' farms, the rest being grassland, evenly divided as before. On most farms, the farmer, plus part-time assistance from wife or son was the labour. Most farms are owner occupied and well mechanised. Dairy farmers are disappointed at E.E.C quota limitations on milk production. Beef and cereal producers worry that their products are in surplus. However a 12.1 ha block sold at 5928.00 pounds per ha and farmers living standards do not appear to have suffered yet. The harvest was late due to high rainfall, most cereal crops were badly lodged.
